key_mistakes.reason: Passive pawn move that doesn't challenge the center.
Develops the bishop but misses the opportunity to control the center.
Allows opponent's bishop more activity without gaining much.
King safety is compromised when the opponent has active pieces.
Misplaces the knight and doesn't address threats.
Too late to prevent the attack on the bishop.
Captures with the wrong piece, leading to unfavorable exchanges.
Misplaces the queen, missing direct threats.
Fails to protect critical pieces and loses material.
Blunder that allows a decisive attack.
Blunder that results in a significant material loss.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center with pawns and pieces.
Prioritize king safety, especially in open positions.
Ensure pieces are active and well-coordinated.
Evaluate exchanges carefully to avoid unfavorable trades.
